description: One British dad and one American dad are building a gazebo for their children’s wedding. They must learn how to communicate with each other despite their cultural differences.
name: A Special Relationship
attribute_SeriesProducer: Twilight Theatre Co. in association with Take Note Theatre

description: A new dad joins a local white supremacist group to try to get an advantage in his life. After getting surprising results from an ancestry test, he struggles to maintain appearances and must find a way to protect his family after a Black journalist and his daughter start investigating. Part of our AMPLIFY Festival celebrating the playwright Chisa Hutchinson.
name: Amerikin
attribute_SeriesProducer: Primary Stages and Ted Snowdon in association with Jamie deRoy, Jan McAdoo, and Cheryl Wiesenfeld

description: The Hermanos Rivera Deli & Grocery has served its community for more than thirty years but when their landlord decides to sell, it forces the Bodega's owner and its regulars to reconcile the fact New York City is changing, along with their place in it.
name: Barn Series: BODEGUEROS

description: In this retelling of A Midsummer Nights Dream when Hermia is confronted with the choice to marry Demetrius, go to a nunnery, or die, this Hermia chooses death! But her father, Theseus, and the court aren't having it. Soooooo, lost in a nunnery with Thisbe, moonshine and a tree, Hermia fights her way back to life with poetry, love and maybe just a little magic.
name: Barn Series: DON'T BELIEVE IN FAIRIES

description: Morris is tired of being emotionally triggered by men, women and animals. He leaps into the dream world of his unconscious where he is joined by two shape shifting guides: his deceased MA and DA…hoping the journey can lead him up and out of who he was, and into a new experience of who he is becoming…
name: Barn Series: IMPLICIT MEMORY SYSTEMS: A JUNGIAN FARCE

description: “Why do I suddenly get so wet, so often, now that I am in my late forties?” A middle-aged woman is awakened by unpredictable physical responses that lead her on a dangerous journey.
name: Barn Series: MY BODY SAYS NO

description: A comedy, six scenes and an epilogue. 4 friends. Upstate New York. Shifting status. Things aren’t what they seem.
name: Barn Series: NEW YORK "OH, THE NEED" TALKIN' DIARY

description: A man returns to the scene of the crime. A Jew and a German.
name: Barn Series: THE GERMAN

description: Matt Shears is one of the oldest players in the NFL. His wife Emily wants him out of the league, now, but when Matt's plan to retire after a Super Bowl win gets derailed, he tries to convince her he should hold out for one more year.
name: Barn Series: THE STARTERS

description: A new play by Irish company Fishamble, Fight Night is a journey following a failed boxer from a long line of professional fighters trying to make a professional comeback while wrestling with family expectations.
name: Fight Night
attribute_SeriesProducer: Fishamble: The New Play Company presents Rise Productions' FIGHT NIGHT

description: A theatrical cabaret sharing the story of Gertrude Lawrence, a feisty, strong woman who forged her stage and screen career in her 50s. This show features well-loved songs from Noel Coward to Kurt Weill.
name: Gertrude Lawrence: A Lovely Way to Spend an Evening

description: A new play by Irish company Fishamble about an adult child struggling to cope with her mother’s mental illness. It's a deeply personal, funny, and life-affirming look at bipolar disorder
name: In Two Minds

description: Franz Kafka is best known for his book Metamorphosis. In this play, Jack Klaff from Star Wars portrays his friends, lovers, and critics to share little known details about Kafka’s life.
name: Kafka

description: A new play by Tony award winning playwright Ken Ludwig, who wrote Lend Me a Tenor and Crazy for You. Dear Jack, Dear Louise is a romantic comedy about the true story of Ken’s parents falling in love by exchanging letters during World War II.
name: Ken Ludwig's DEAR JACK, DEAR LOUISE

description:
The Rooster of Barcelos is Portugal’s most popular souvenir. Legends say he miraculously came back to life at the dinner table to save a pilgrim wrongly accused of a crime, but the rooster himself has more than a few questions about his own story.
 
He demands answers from Prime Minister Salazar, the fascist dictator who ruled Portugal for 40 years. The gloves are off and the feathers are flying as the Rooster and Salazar throw down over the pretty lies and ugly fictions that crippled the people of Portugal for decades.
 
From Pulitzer Prize and Tony Award-winning playwright Robert Schenkkan in collaboration with Portugal's premier Theater Company, Mala Voadora, comes an outrageous political satire that reminds us how easily stories can be corrupted and cautions us to watch out for fowl play.

Presented in partnership with Under the Radar / utrfest.org
name: Old Cock
attribute_SeriesProducer: Mala Voadora in association with Twilight Theatre Co. & Peacedale Global Arts

description: Pecking Order is inspired by the red tail hawk Pale Male that lived in Central Park. Using elements of magical realism, two hawks build a nest on a ritzy apartment building on the Upper East Side and the doorman is determined to protect them despite many of the building’s residents wanting them gone. (If they ask ‘what is magical realism?’ A genre that blurs the lines between fantasy and reality)
name: Pecking Order

description: A new adaptation of Jane Austen’s much loved story. Pride and Prejudice is the quintessential British romantic comedy.
name: Pride & Prejudice

description: Radio Downtown is the latest show from The Civilians, who recently produced Artificial Flavors and The Unbelieving. Made from archival interviews from the WNYC Arts Forum, a radio show from the 1970s about avant garde artists such as Harry Smith and Yvonne Rainer, this show uses their words verbatim to channel the voices of these radical artists.
name: Radio Downtown: Radical '70s Artists Live on Air

description: A young solider returns from war and needs a job to support his family. He interviews with a local painter and has to face another kind of madness in his studio.
name: Shellshocked
attribute_SeriesProducer: Richard Jordan Productions and 412 with Lawrence Batley Theatre, Harrogate Theatre in association with Pleasance

description:
Two roommates living in Hells Kitchen in 1985 are struggling with breaking through as artists but are torn between work, love, and family expectations. 
Part of LAB: STRIPPED, short runs of works still in progress that will have minimal set and technical designs so we can focus on the scripts.
name: STRIPPED: House of Blue Robes

description:
When a figure from a traumatic event in her childhood returns, a woman has to face how her past has affected who she is now. 
Part of LAB: STRIPPED, short runs of works still in progress that will have minimal set and technical designs so we can focus on the scripts.
name: STRIPPED: Recurring

description: Inspired by the 1718 cookbook Mrs. Mary Eales Receipts, during the show Mary presents her most famous dishes with a live cooking presentation a la Julia Child.
name: Sugarcraft

description: Three of Britain’s all-time greatest comedy heroes – Tommy Cooper, Eric Morecambe, and Bob Monkhouse reminisce about the golden age of television comedy and ponder what it means to be really funny.
name: The Last Laugh

description: Partly using real stories, The Mistake explores a terrifying new era of warfare after the atomic bomb was dropped on Hiroshima
name: The Mistake

description: The origin story of Witchfinder General Matthew Hopkins and his infamous reign of terror in rural England in 1645
name: The Ungodly
